Name: Curcumin
Description: Naturally occurring orange/yellow colour Extracted from the spice turmeric
Usage: Commonly found in pastries, confectionery, sauces, and soups

Name: Riboflavin or lactoflavin (Vitamin B2)
Description: Naturally occurring B-group vitamin, Usually obtained from yeast or produced synthetically
Usage: Enrichment and fortification of food, Also found in processed cheese as yellow/orange colour

Name: Tartrazine
Description: Widely used yellow/orange colour
Usage: Found in soft drinks, cakes, biscuits, puddings, meat products, sauces, tinned and packet convenience foods and confectionery

Name: Quinoline Yellow
Description: A synthetic coal tar dye, greenish yellow in colour
Usage: Used with other yellow colours, especially in smoked fish

Name: Sunset Yellow FCF or Orange Yellow S
Description: A synthetic coal tar dye, yellow in colour, used with E102
Usage: Found in soft drinks, cakes, biscuits, puddings, meat products, sauces, tinned and packet convenience foods and confectionery

Name: Cochineal or Carminic acid or Carmines
Description: Natural red colour obtained from egg yolk and dried insects, Can be manufactured

Name: Azorubine or Carmoisine
Description: A synthetic coal tar dye, red/purple in colour
Usage: Often added to raspberry and chocolate flavoured desserts, marzipan, jam, cherryade, bottled sauce, and breaded products

Name: Amaranth
Description: A synthetic coal tar dye, red in colour
Usage: Sometimes used in gravy mixes, meat patties, and blackcurrant drinks

Name: Ponceau 4R or Cochineal Red A
Description: A synthetic coal tar dye, red in colour
Usage: Often used to restore red colour to tinned strawberries,Also added to strawberry jam, jelly and ice cream, tomato soup, savoury rice, cheesecake mix, and some meat products

Name: Erythrosine
Description: A synthetic coal tar dye, red in colour, Rich in mineral iodine
Usage: Regular component of glace cherries, peach melba yogurt, vacuum-packed ham and pork, tinned strawberries, and certain flavours of chips and potato-based snacks

Name: Red 2G
Description: A synthetic coal tar dye, red in colour
Usage: Now banned in many countries including the EU and USA

Name: Allura Red AC
Description: Colouring agent
Usage: Commonly found in drinks, baked goods, meat products, and sweets

Name: Patent Blue V
Description: Colouring agent
Usage: Commonly found in some meat products

Name: lndigotine or Indigo Carmine
Description: A synthetic coal tar dye, blue in colour
Usage: Also found in gravy mix and certain meat products

Name: Brilliant Blue FCF
Description: A synthetic coal tar dye, blue in colour, Often mixed with E102 to make green

Name: Chlorophyll and chlorophyllins
Description: Naturally occurring green pigment found plant leaves and stems Also manufactured
Usage: Also found in green vegetables to enhance their colour

Name: Copper complexes of chlorophyll and chlorophyllins
Description: A more stable colour obtained by a reaction between copper and manufactured chlorophyll
Usage: Used to heighten the green colour of products such as cucumber relish

Name: Green S
Description: A synthetic coal tar dye, green in colour
Usage: Used to restore the expected green colour to tinned peas, Also added to asparagus soup, lemon or lime drinks and jellies, and mint sauce

Name: Plain caramel
Description: Commonly used brown colour and adds flavor made from the caramelisation or burning of sugar by heat or chemicals, No ammonium or sulphite reactants
Usage: Commonly found in soft drinks, gravy mix, brown bread, cakes, biscuits, malt vinegar, marmalade, and beef products

Name: Caustic sulphite caramel
Description: With sulphite reactant, but no ammonium
Usage: Commonly found in tea, whiskey, and brandy

Name: Ammonia caramel
Description: With ammonium reactant, but no sulphite
Usage: Used to colour soy sauce and beer

Name: Sulphite ammonia caramel
Description: Colouring agent, With both sulphite and ammonia reactants

Name: Brilliant Black BN or Black PN
Description: A synthetic coal tar dye, black in colour

Name: Vegetable carbon
Description: Natural black colour obtained from burnt plant material, now often manufactured
Usage: Also found in concentrated fruit juices, preserves, and jellies

Name: Brown HT
Description: A synthetic coal tar dye, brown in colour

Name: Carotenoids
Description: Plant pigments derived from carrots, tomatoes, apricots, oranges, rose hip and green leafy vegetables, Now mostly manufactured
Usage: Provide a range of colours from yellow to red

Name: Alpha-, beta, and gamma-carotenes
Description: Beta-carotene is a well-known substance that is converted by the body to Vitamin A, Orange in colour
Usage: Also found in biscuits, cakes, margarine, creamed rice, cheese products, and certain soups

Name: Annatto
Description: Orange/peach pigment naturally present in butter and cheese
Usage: Used to give creamy colour to creamed rice, coffee creamer, pastry, cheese, and cheese products

Name: Paprika extract or Capsanthian; Capsorubin
Description: Colouring agent (red)
Usage: Can be used to add colour and flavour to various food products

Name: Lycopene
Description: Colouring agent (red), Carotenoid
Usage: May be used in processed foods, beverages, and ketchup

Name: Beta-apo-8'-carotenal (C30); apocarotenal
Description: Colouring agent (orange/red), Carotenoid

Name: Lutein
Description: Colouring agent (yellow/orange), Carotenoid
Usage: Has been used as a chicken feed additive to promote yellow colouring of egg yolks

Name: Canthaxanthin
Description: Colouring agent (reddish/orange), Carotenoid
Usage: May be present in food and self-tanning products

Name: Betanin (Beetroot Red)
Description: Naturally occurring red/purple colour in beetroots

Name: Anthocyanins
Description: Plant pigments with colours ranging from red to blue, Naturally present in red cabbage and grapes
Usage: Commonly found in producing purple-colored beverages, confectionaries, and jams

Name: Calcium carbonate (chalk)
Description: Naturally occurring mineral
Usage: Various functions including acid regulator, firming agent, releasing agent, and nutrient, Also found in white flour as a calcium supplement to replace the loss due to refining, Frequently an ingredient in bread and baked products

Name: Titanium dioxide
Description: Colouring agent
Usage: Use no longer permitted in the EU and in Northern Ireland as of Feb 2022

Name: Iron oxides and hydroxides
Description: Naturally occurring mineral
Usage: Also found in fortify food, Also found in flour and breakfast cereals

Name: Aluminium
Description: Colouring agent (silver/grey)
Usage: Surface coating (eg, for cake decoration or confectionary)

Name: Silver
Description: Colouring agent
Usage: May be used for silver surface coating

Name: Gold
Description: Colouring agent
Usage: May be used for gold surface coating

Name: Lithol rubine BK
Description: Colouring agent (red)

Name: Sorbic acid
Description: Naturally occurring in some fruit but generally manufactured synthetically for use as a food helps keep food fresh
Usage: Commonly added to soft drinks, cheese spread, frozen pizza, and cakes

Name: Potassium sorbate
Description: Salt of sorbic acid

Name: Benzoic acid
Description: Occurs naturally in cherry bark, raspberries, tea, anise, and cassia bark, but largely prepared synthetically for commercial use
Usage: Acts as a preservative and antioxidant most frequently in fruit products, soft drinks, pickled produce, and salad dressings

Name: Sodium benzoate
Description: Salt of benzoic acid

Name: Potassium benzoate
Description: Salt of benzoic acid

Name: Calcium benzoate
Description: Salt of benzoic acid

Name: Ethyl p-hydroxybenzoate
Description: Preservative, Salt of benzoic acid

Name: Sodium ethyl p-hydroxybenzoate
Description: Preservative, Salt of benzoic acid

Name: Methyl p-hydroxybenzoate
Description: Salt of benzoic acid

Name: Sodium methyl p-hydroxybenzoate
Description: Preservative, Salt of benzoic acid

Name: Sulfur dioxide
Description: Gas prepared chemically for use as a food helps keep food fresh, flour improver, bleaching agent, and Vitamin C keeps texture stable
Usage: Found in carbonated drinks, marmalade, glace cherries, mixed peel, cakes, fruit based products, and meat products

Name: Sodium sulphite
Description: Preservative
Usage: May be used to prevent discolouration in dried fruit

Name: Sodium hydrogen sulphite
Description: Synthetic helps keep food fresh and bleaching agent
Usage: Often added to wine and beer

Name: Sodium metabisulphite
Description: Synthetic helps keep food fresh
Usage: Also found in sausages and some bottled sauces

Name: Potassium metabisulphite
Description: Preservative
Usage: Sometimes used to preserve beer, wine, and other fermented beverages

Name: Calcium sulphite
Description: Preservative

Name: Calcium hydrogen sulphite
Description: Preservative
Usage: May be used in canned fruit and beer products

Name: Potassium hydrogen sulphite
Description: Preservative
Usage: May be used in alcoholic beverages

Name: Nisin
Description: Preservative

Name: Ascorbic acid (Vitamin C)
Description: Occurs naturally in fruit and vegetables but is synthesised biologically, Acts as a helps keep food fresh, anti-oxidant, meat colour fixative, and flour improver, Also a vitamin
Usage: Found in fruit juices, bread, baked products, powdered mashed potatoes, and other products

Name: Sodium ascorbate
Description: Salt of ascorbic acid

Name: Calcium ascorbate
Description: Salt of ascorbic acid

Name: Fatty acid esters of ascorbic acid
Description: Salt of ascorbic acid
Usage: Commonly found in sausage and cured meats

Name: Tocopherol (Vitamin E)
Description: Obtained from soya bean oil, wheatgerm, rice germ, cottonseed, maize, and green leaves
Usage: Also found in fats and oils, Used as an antioxidant and nutrient

Name: Alpha-tocopherol
Description: Synthetic products of tocopherol with similar functions (see E306)
Usage: Also found in fats and oils

Name: Gamma-tocopherol
Description: Synthetic products of tocopherol with similar functions (see E306)
Usage: Also found in fats and oils

Name: Delta-tocopherol
Description: Synthetic products of tocopherol with similar functions (see E306)
Usage: Also found in fats and oils

Name: Propyl gallate
Description: Synthetically prepared antioxidant
Usage: Also found in fats and oils Found in fried foods, May give rise to a bitter taste

Name: Erythorbic acid
Description: Antioxidant

Name: Sodium erythorbate
Description: Antioxidant

Name: Tertiary-butyl hydroquinone (TBHQ)
Description: Antioxidant

Name: Butylated hydroxyanisole (BHA)
Description: Antioxidant manufactured synthetically for use alone or with E280, E310, or E330
Usage: Often found in chips and other potato snacks, biscuits, pastry, bottled sauces, and fried foods

Name: Butylated hydroxytoluene (BHT)
Description: Synthetically prepared antioxidant

Name: Extracts of rosemary
Description: Antioxidant

Name: 4-Hexylresorcinol
Description: Antioxidant

Description: Occurs naturally in fruit and vegetables but is synthesised biologically, Acts as a helps keep food fresh, anti-oxidant, meat colour fixative, and flour improver, Also a vitamin
Usage: Found in fruit juices, bread, baked products, powdered mashed potatoes, and other products

Usage: Also found in fats and oils, Used as an antioxidant and nutrient

Description: Antioxidant

Usage: Often found in chips and other potato snacks, biscuits, pastry, bottled sauces, and fried foods

Name: Butylated hydroxytoluene (BHT)
Description: Synthetically prepared antioxidant

Name: Extracts of rosemary
Description: Antioxidant

Name: 4-Hexylresorcinol
Description: Antioxidant

Name: Lecithins
Description: Type of fat or lipid compound found naturally in all living organisms, protective against cholesterol deposition
Usage: Found in chocolate and chocolate products, powdered milk, margarine, and potato snacks, Egg yolk is a rich source of lecithins, but commercially, most is obtained from soya beans, Used as an antioxidant and emulsifier

Name: Alginic acid
Description: Emulsifier, keeps texture stable, gelling agent, and makes foods thicker extracted from brown seaweed
Usage: Frequently added to ice cream, instant desserts, and puddings

Name: Sodium alginate
Description: Salt of alginic acid with similar functions (see E400)

Name: Potassium alginate
Description: Salt of alginic acid with similar functions (see E400)

Name: Ammonium alginate
Description: Salt of alginic acid with similar functions (see E400)

Name: Calcium alginate
Description: Salt of alginic acid with similar functions (see E400)

Name: Propane-1,2-diol alginate; propylene glycol alginate (PGA)
Description: Emulsifier, keeps texture stable, makes foods thicker, and gelling agent, Ester made from alginic acid (E400) and propylene glycol (E1520)

Name: Agar
Description: Naturally occurring gum extracted from seaweeds, Not digested so acts a source of dietary fibre, Also acts as a keeps texture stable and gelling agent
Usage: Commonly found in tinned ham, meat glazes, and in ice cream

Name: Carrageenan (Irish moss)
Description: Gum naturally present in red seaweed
Usage: Found in ice cream, Used as an emulsifier, stabiliser, and gelling agent, Alternative to gelatin

Name: Processed eucheuma seaweed
Description: Emulsifier, keeps texture stable, makes foods thicker, and gelling agent

Name: Locust bean gum; carob gum
Description: Natural extract from the Carob tree seed, Similar to E407
Usage: Also found in ice cream, and soups

Name: Xanthan gum
Description: A natural polysaccharide derived from fermented sugars.
Usage: In the food industry as a thickening and stabilizing agent.

Name: Karaya gum
Description: Emulsifier, keeps texture stable, makes foods thicker, and gelling agent
Usage: food additive enhances texture and prevents ingredient separation in a wide range of products

Name: Tara gum
Description: Emulsifier, keeps texture stable, makes foods thicker, and gelling agent

Name: Gellan gum
Description: Emulsifier, keeps texture stable, makes foods thicker, and gelling agent

Name: Konjac
Description: Emulsifier, keeps texture stable, makes foods thicker, and gelling agent

Name: Polyoxyethylene sorbitan mono-oleate; Polysorbate 80
Description: Emulsifier, keeps texture stable, makes foods thicker, and gelling agent

Name: Polyoxyethylene sorbitan monopalmitate; Polysorbate 40
Description: Emulsifier, keeps texture stable, makes foods thicker, and gelling agent

Name: Polyoxyethylene sorbitan monostearate; Polysorbate 60
Description: Emulsifier, keeps texture stable, makes foods thicker, and gelling agent, Prepared from sorbitol (E420)

Name: Polyoxyethylene sorbitan tristearate; Polysorbate 65
Description: Emulsifier, keeps texture stable, makes foods thicker, and gelling agent

Name: Pectin
Description: Occurs naturally in fruits, roots, and stems of plants
Usage: Used as a stabiliser and gelling agent, Also found in preserves, jellies, and mint sauce

Name: Amidated pectin
Description: Chemically treated pectin used as an helps mix ingredients and gelling agent

Name: Ammonium phosphatide
Description: Emulsifier, keeps texture stable, makes foods thicker, and gelling agent

Name: Sucrose acetate isobutyrate
Description: Emulsifier, keeps texture stable, makes foods thicker, and gelling agent

Name: Glycerol esters of wood rosins
Description: Emulsifier, keeps texture stable, makes foods thickers, and gelling agent

Name: Cellulose
Description: Fibrous part of plant cell walls used as a bulking agent
Usage: Commonly found in high fibre bread and low-calorie products

Name: Methyl cellulose
Description: Derived from cellulose with similar properties

Name: Ethyl cellulose
Description: Emulsifier, keeps texture stable, makes foods thicker, and gelling agent

Name: Hydroxypropyl cellulose
Description: Emulsifier, keeps texture stable, makes foods thicker, and gelling agent

Name: Hydroxypropyl methyl cellulose
Description: Emulsifier, keeps texture stable, makes foods thicker, and gelling agent

Name: Ethyl methyl cellulose
Description: Derived from cellulose with similar properties
Usage: Also found in fruit cake and bottled sauces

Name: Carboxymethyl cellulose
Description: Derived from cellulose with similar properties
Usage: Commonly found in ice cream, cream products, and cheesecake mix

Name: Crosslinked sodium carboxymethyl cellulose
Description: Emulsifier, keeps texture stable, makes foods thicker, and gelling agent

Name: Enzymatically hydrolysed carboxymethyl cellulose
Description: Emulsifier, keeps texture stable, makes foods thicker, and gelling agent

Name: Sodium, potassium, and calcium salts of fatty acids
Description: Synthetically manufactured helps mix ingredientss, keeps texture stables, and anti-caking agents

Name: Magnesium salts of fatty acids
Description: Emulsifiers, keeps texture stables, makes foods thickers, and gelling agents

Name: Mono- and diglycerides of fatty acids
Description: Normal products of fat digestion but are prepared synthetically
Usage: Frequently added to powdered milk, packet soup, cake, crisps, potato snacks, bread, baked products, and margarine

Name: Acetic acid esters of mono- and diglycerides of fatty acids
Description: Emulsifiers, keeps texture stables, makes foods thickers, and gelling agents

Name: Lactic acid esters of mono- and diglycerides of fatty acids
Description: Emulsifiers, keeps texture stables, makes foods thickers, and gelling agents

Name: Citric acid esters of mono- and diglycerides of fatty acids
Description: Emulsifiers, keeps texture stables, makes foods thickers, and gelling agents

Name: Tartaric acid esters of mono- and diglycerides of fatty acids
Description: Emulsifiers, keeps texture stables, makes foods thickers, and gelling agents

Name: Mono- and diacetyltartaric acid esters of mono- and diglycerides of fatty acids
Description: Emulsifiers, keeps texture stables, makes foods thickers, and gelling agents

Name: Mixed acetic and tartaric acid esters of mono- and diglycerides of fatty acids
Description: Emulsifiers, keeps texture stables, makes foods thickers, and gelling agents

Name: Sucrose esters of fatty acids
Description: Emulsifiers, keeps texture stables, makes foods thickers, and gelling agents

Name: Sucroglycerides
Description: Emulsifiers, keeps texture stables, makes foods thickers, and gelling agents

Name: Polyglycerol esters of fatty acids
Description: Synthetic product of E471 used as an helps mix ingredients and keeps texture stable

Name: Polyglycerol polyricinoleate
Description: Emulsifiers, keeps texture stables, makes foods thickers, and gelling agents

Name: Propane-1,2-diol esters of fatty acids
Description: Emulsifiers, keeps texture stables, makes foods thickers, and gelling agents

Name: Thermally oxidised soya bean oil interacted with mono- and diglycerides of fatty acids
Description: Emulsifier, keeps texture stable, makes foods thicker, and gelling agent

Name: Sodium stearoyl-2-lactylate
Description: Prepared synthetically from lactic acid
Usage: Potato snacks, Used as a stabiliser and emulsifier

Name: Calcium stearoyl-2-lactylate
Description: Emulsifier, keeps texture stable, makes foods thicker, and gelling agent

Name: Stearyl tartrate
Description: Emulsifier, keeps texture stable, makes foods thicker, and gelling agent

Name: Sorbitan monostearate
Description: Emulsifier, keeps texture stable, makes foods thicker, and gelling agent

Name: Sorbitan tristearate
Description: Emulsifier, keeps texture stable, makes foods thicker, and gelling agent

Name: Sorbitan monolaurate
Description: Emulsifier, keeps texture stable, makes foods thicker, and gelling agent

Name: Sorbitan monooleate
Description: Emulsifier, keeps texture stable, makes foods thicker, and gelling agent

Name: Sorbitan monopalmitate
Description: Emulsifier, keeps texture stable, makes foods thicker, and gelling agent

Name: Invertase
Description: Emulsifier, keeps texture stable, makes foods thicker, and gelling agent

Name: Mannitol
Description: Sugar alcohol derived from mannose, but general manufactured from seaweed, Acts as a sweetener, helps mix ingredients, anti-caking agent, and makes foods thicker
Usage: Commonly found in confectionery and desserts

Name: Edible bone phosphate
Description: Produced from animal bones, Used as anti-caking agent, helps mix ingredients and source of phosphorous in food supplements. Main use, however, is in cosmetics (such as tooth paste)

Name: Acesulfame K
Description: a Sweetener
Usage: Low-calorie sweetener used in various food and drinks

Name: Aspartame
Description: New artificial sweetener of protein origin, Contains phenylalanine
Usage: Artificial sweeteners, confectionery, ice cream, low calorie desserts, and soft drinks

Name: Cyclamic acid and its Na and Ca salts
Description: Artificial sweetener

Name: lsomalt
Description: Sweetener, High temperature stability
Usage: Used as a sweetener in heat-treated products eg, bakery products

Name: Saccharin and its Na, K, and Ca salts
Description: Calorie-free artificial sweetener
Usage: Low calorie products, soft drinks, and confectionery

Name: Sucralose
Description: Sweetener
Usage: Candy, breakfast bars, soft drinks, canned fruits

Name: Thaumatin
Description: Sweetener, Natural plant protein
Usage: May be used in beverages, dairy products, or chewing gum

Name: Neohesperidine DC
Description: Sweetener, Derived from citrus
Usage: Widely used in desserts, dairy products, confectionary, and beverages

Name: Steviol glycoside
Description: Sweetener
Usage: Widely used in carbonated soft drinks, juice, tea, desserts, dairy products, confectionary, and other products

Name: Neotame
Description: Sweetener, similar to aspartame (E951)

Name: Salt of aspartame-acesulfame
Description: Low-calorie sweetener

Name: Polyglycitol syrup
Description: Sweetener

Name: Maltitol
Description: Naturally occurring sugar in grapes and corn
Usage: Confectionery, cakes, biscuits, puddings, desserts, soft drinks, convenience foods

Name: Lactitol
Description: Synthetic sweetener, Derived from lactose
Usage: Replacement bulk sweetener for low-calorie foods

Name: Xylitol
Description: a Sweetener
Usage: Widely used as sugar substitute eg, confectionary, sweet sauces, liqueurs, jams, desserts

Name: Erythritol
Description: Sweetener, Made from carbohydrate fermentation

Name: Advantame
Description: Sweetener
Usage: Tabletop sweetener, confectionary, bubblegum, flavoured drinks, and other products

Name: Sorbitol
Description: Sugar alcohol produced from glucose Less quickly absorbed than sugar so often used as a sweetener Also used as a humectant and food colour diluent May have a laxative effect in large doses
Usage: Widely used in diabetic confectionery, preserves, biscuits, cakes, and soft drinks

Name: Acetic acid
Description: Natural component of vinegar but generally manufactured from wood, Used as a helps keep food fresh, acid, or colour diluent
Usage: Found in pickles, bottled sauces, and chutneys

Name: Potassium acetate
Description: Flavour agent, helps keep food fresh, and used to control acidity, Potassium salt of acetic acid (E260)
Usage: Used as flavouring agent in snack foods such as potato chips (vinegar taste) Also used in potassium supplements

Name: Sodium acetate
Description: Flavouring agent, helps keep food fresh, and acid, Sodium salt of acetic acid (E260)
Usage: Salt and vinegar chip flavouring, among other uses

Name: Calcium acetate
Description: Flavouring agent, helps keep food fresh, and acid, Calcium salt of acetic acid (E260)

Name: Lactic acid
Description: Produced by the fermentation of lactose (the sugar present in milk), Occurs naturally in soured milk and yoghurt, Acts as a helps keep food fresh, acid, flavour, and assists the action of antioxidants
Usage: Widely used in salad dressings, cakes, biscuits, confectionery, and certain types of prepared meat dishes

Name: Carbon dioxide
Description: Gas present in air, but produced synthetically for food, Adds the fizz to fizzy drinks (carbonation), Also used as a coolant, freezant, propellant, helps keep food fresh, and packaging gas

Name: Malic acid
Description: Flavouring agent, used to control acidity, colour keeps texture stable

Name: Fumaric acid
Description: Prepared synthetically as an acid flavour

Name: Sodium lactate
Description: Preservative, used to control acidity, and bulking agent

Name: Potassium lactate
Description: Preservative

Name: Calcium lactate
Description: Firming agent, adds flavor, makes foods thicker, keeps texture stable, antioxidant
Usage: Commonly found in fruit and vegetable processing, May be used in calcium supplements

Name: Citric acid; lemon salt
Description: Acidity regulator, helps keep food fresh
Usage: Commonly used in canned foods, snacks, ice creams, soft drinks

Name: Sodium citrates
Description: Preservatives, adds flavors, helps mix ingredientss, Sodium salt of citric acid (E330)

Name: Potassium citrates
Description: Acidity regulators, adds flavors, Potassium salt of citric acid (E330)
Usage: As well as food additive, may be used to treat kidney stones

Name: Calcium citrates
Description: Preservatives, adds flavors, Calcium salt of citric acid (E330)
Usage: As well as food additive, sometimes used in calcium supplements

Name: Tartaric acid (L-(+))
Description: Acidity regulator, adds flavor, raising agent, keeps texture stable

Name: Sodium tartrates
Description: Acidity regulators, keeps texture stables & Sodium salts of tartaric acid (E334)
Usage: Binding agent in jellies, margarine, and sausage casings

Name: Potassium tartrates
Description: Acidity regulators, keeps texture stables, Potassium salts of tartaric acid (E334), Potassium bitartrate = cream of tartar

Name: Sodium potassium tartrates
Description: Acidity regulators, keeps texture stables, Double salts of tartaric acid

Name: Phosphoric acid
Description: Acid, flavouring

Name: Sodium phosphates
Description: Acidity regulator, makes foods thicker, helps mix ingredients, Sodium salt of phosphoric acid (E338)
Usage: Found in meat, cheese, and baked products

Name: Potassium phosphates
Description: Acidity regulator, raising agent, keeps texture stable, Potassium salt of phosphoric acid (E338)
Usage: As well as food additive, also used in some potassium supplements

Name: Calcium phosphates
Description: Anti-caking agent, helps mix ingredients, keeps texture stable, used to control acidity, Calcium salt of phosphoric acid (E338)
Usage: Used to prevent lumps in powdered foods, Also used in some nutritional supplements

Name: Magnesium phosphates
Description: Acidity regulator, anti-caking agent, keeps texture stable

Name: Sodium malate
Description: Acidity regulator, adds flavor, Sodium salt of malic acid (E296)

Name: Potassium malate
Description: Acidity regulator, antioxidant, adds flavor, Potassium salt of malic acid (E296)

Name: Calcium malate
Description: Acidity regulator, adds flavor, thickening agent, Calcium salt of malic acid (E296)

Name: Metatartaric acid
Description: Acidity regulator

Name: Calcium tartrate
Description: Preservative and used to control acidity, Calcium salt of tartaric acid (E334)

Name: Adipic acid
Description: Acidity regulator, flavouring and raising agent, Naturally present in beets and sugar cane
Usage: Commonly found in baking powders, fizzy drinks, and drink mixes

Name: Sodium adipate
Description: Sodium salt of adipic acid

Name: Potassium adipate
Description: Potassium salt of adipic acid

Name: Succinic acid
Description: Acidity regulator, flavouring, fragrance

Name: Triammonium citrate
Description: Acid regulator, buffer, helps mix ingredients, Ammonium salt of citric acid

Name: Calcium disodium ethylene diamine tetra-acetate; calcium disodium EDTA
Description: Preservative, antioxidant

Name: Glycerol
Description: Flavour enhancer, sweetener, used to add color, helps keep food fresh
Usage: Widely used in baked goods and confectionary

Name: Octenyl succinic acid modified gum arabic
Description: Emulsifier, Chemical modification of gum arabic
Usage: Processed meat, cheeses, jam, snacks, chewing gum

Name: Diphosphates
Description: Acid regulators, helps mix ingredientss, Salts of sodium / potassium / calcium with phosphates

Name: Triphosphates
Description: Preservatives, helps mix ingredientss, keeps texture stables, Potassium and sodium triphosphates

Name: Polyphosphates
Description: Stabilisers, helps mix ingredientss, Polyphosphates of potassium, calcium, ammonium, sodium

Name: Beta-cyclodextrin; betadex
Description: Emulsifier, adds flavor
Usage: Dry mixes (eg, for baking, soups, flavoured coffee or tea), cereal, other processed products

Name: Sodium carbonate
Description: Acidity regulator, anti-caking agent, raising agent, keeps texture stable

Name: Potassium carbonate
Description: Acidity regulator, keeps texture stable, raising agent
Usage: Baking, Can be used in potassium supplements

Name: Ammonium carbonate
Description: Acidity regulator, keeps texture stable, leavening agent

Name: Magnesium carbonate
Description: Acidity regulator, used to add color, anti-caking agent; May have laxative effect in high concentrations
Usage: Salts, icing sugar, dry mixes, Dietary supplements (source of magnesium)

Name: Hydrochloric acid
Description: Acidity regulator

Name: Potassium chloride
Description: Flavouring agent, makes foods thicker

Name: Calcium chloride
Description: Preservative, keeps texture stable, firming agent, anti-caking agent, acid regulator
Usage: Various food products, also used in some calcium supplements

Name: Magnesium chloride
Description: Stabiliser, firming agent

Name: Stannous chloride
Description: Antioxidant, colour retention agent

Name: Sulphuric acid
Description: Acidity regulator

Description: Acid regulator, anti-caking agent, Potassium salt of sulphuric acid

Description: Buffer, firming agent, Calcium salt of sulphuric acid

Description: Aluminium salt of sulphuric acid

Description: Acidity regulator
Usage: Baking, and chocolate, cocoa, fruit, and olive processing

Description: Acidity regulator, keeps texture stable, thickening agent

Usage: Beer production, Pretzel glazing Vegetable processing

Description: Acidity regulator

Description: Anti-caking agent, used to control acidity

Description: Acidity regulator, raising agent

Description: Anti-caking agent, used to control acidity

Description: Anti-caking agent

Description: Anti-caking agent

Usage: Found in chewing gum, meat pies, salt, and confectionery

Name: (i) Magnesium silicate, (ii) Magnesium trisilicate
Description: Salt of silicon dioxide with similar functions

Name: Talc
Description: Anti-caking agent, bulking agent, glazing agent

Name: Sodium aluminium silicate
Description: Anti-caking agent
Usage: Commonly found in salt and sugar products, egg mixes, flours, dried milk substitutes

Name: Potassium aluminium silicate
Description: Anti-caking agent

Name: Fatty acids; stearic acid
Description: Anti-caking agent, adds flavor
Usage: Baked products, chewing gum, confectionary, artificial sweeteners

Name: Gluconic acid
Description: Acidity regulator

Name: Glucono delta-lactone (GDL); gluconolactone
Description: Acidity regulator, helps keep food fresh, raising agent
Usage: Tofu making, Baked, meat, and cheese products

Name: Sodium gluconate
Description: Stabiliser, makes foods thicker, sequestrant, Sodium salt of gluconic acid

Name: Potassium gluconate
Description: Sequestrant, keeps texture stable, anti-caking, thickening agent,, Potassium salt of gluconic acid

Name: Calcium gluconate
Description: Anti-caking agent, makes foods thicker, keeps texture stable, used to control acidity, Calcium salt of gluconic acid
Usage: Health products eg, bodybuilding formulas, sports drinks, Cereal; Beverages, Dietary supplements (calcium source)

Name: Ferrous gluconate
Description: Colouring agent, nutritional supplement
Usage: Processing black olives, Iron source (food fortification)

Name: Ferrous lactate
Description: Acidity regulator, flavouring, colour retention agent, nutritional supplement

Name: L-Glutamic acid
Description: Naturally occurring amino acid obtained from protein but generally manufactured by bacterial fermentation of carbohydrates
Usage: Used as a nutrient to increase protein values , Used as a flavour enhancer and salt substitute

Name: Monosodium glutamate (MSG)
Description: Present naturally in seaweed but generally prepared chemically from sugar beet, Flavour enhancer of protein rich foods
Usage: Meat, Chinese foods, packet convenience meals and snacks (eg, soup), dried products, crisps, and potato snacks

Name: Monopotassium glutamate
Description: Similar to monosodium glutamate

Name: Calcium glutamate
Description: Similar to monosodium glutamate

Name: Monoammonium glutamate
Description: Ammonium salt of glutamic acid

Name: Magnesium diglutamate
Description: More expensive additive
Usage: May be found in snacks, packet soups, and instant noodles

Name: Guanylic acid
Description: More expensive additive
Usage: May be found in snacks, packet soups, and instant noodles

Name: Disodium guanylate
Description: Occurs naturally in sardines and yeast extract but generally manufactured synthetically, Used as a flavour enhancer
Usage: Often added to crisps and other potato snacks, gravy granules and pre-cooked dried rice

Name: Dipotassium guanylate
Description: Flavour enhancer, Potassium salt of guanylic acid

Name: Calcium guanylate
Description: Flavour enhancer, Calcium salt of guanylic acid

Name: Inosinic acid
Description: Flavour enhancer

Name: Disodium inosinate
Description: Made from sardines and meat extract

Name: Dipotassium inosinate
Description: Flavour enhancer

Name: Calcium inosinate
Description: Flavour enhancer

Name: Calcium 5'-ribonucleotides
Description: Flavour enhancer
Usage: Mainly used in low sodium (low salt) products

Name: Sodium-5-ribonucleotide
Description: Mixture of E627 and E631
Usage: Also found in crisps, potato snacks, and packet soups

Name: Glycine and its sodium salt
Description: Glycine is an amino acid, Used as flavour enhancer and sweetener
Usage: Bread enhancer, Also used in food supplements and protein drinks

Name: L-leucine
Description: Flavouring agent, Amino acid

Name: Zinc acetate
Description: Flavour enhancer

Name: Dimethylpolysiloxane
Description: Anti-foaming agent

Description: Glazing agent

Description: Glazing agent, occlusive

Description: Glazing agent

Name: lanolin
Description: lanolin, a wax from sheep excreted by the skin of sheep and extracted from the wool

Description: Packaging gas

Name: Quillaia extract

Name: lysozyme
Description: An enzyme, that is a normal constituent of tears, saliva, blood and (human) milk. Commercially prepared from chicken eggs or by bacteria.
Usage: Infant nutrition, pharmaceutical preparations, Lysozyme is a protein and all proteins may cause allergic reactions. Should be avoided by vegans.

Name: Polydextrose
Description: Naturally occurring sugar in grapes and corn
Usage: Confectionery, cakes, biscuits, puddings, desserts, soft drinks, and convenience foods

Name: Polyvinylpyrrolidone (PVP)

Usage: Food additive and used in wine production

Name: Polyvinyl alcohol
Description: Thickener, glazing agent, Natural polysaccharide

Name: Pullulan

Name: Basic methacrylate copolymer

Name: Neutral methacrylate copolymer
Description: Glazing agent

Name: Anionic methacrylate copolymer
Description: Glazing/coating agent

Name: Polyvinyl alcohol-polyethylene glycol-graft copolymer; PVA-PEG graft copolymer
Description: Glazing agent, keeps texture stable

Name: Starches
Description: Generally of maize, corn, potato, wheat, or tapioca in origin, Used to modify texture and stability
Usage: Sauces, chutneys, confectionery, desserts, meat, fish, dairy, and baked products

Name: Monostarch phosphate
Description: Anti-caking agent, makes foods thicker, keeps texture stable, helps mix ingredients, glazing agent

Name: Distarch phosphate
Description: Modified starch
Usage: Fruit gels and cream fillings, baked goods

Name: Phosphated distarch phosphate
Description: Stabiliser while freezing / thawing

Name: Acetylated distarch phosphate
Description: Stabiliser, helps mix ingredients

Name: Acetylated starch
Description: Modified starch

Name: Acetylated distarch adipate
Description: Thickening agent

Name: Hydroxyl propyl starch
Description: Modified starch

Name: Glyceryl diacetate; diacetin
Description: Solvent for other additives

Name: Glyceryl triacetate; triacetin
Description: Humectant, adds flavor

Name: Propan-1,2-diol; propylene glycol
Description: Synthetic carrier for extracts, flavours, and spices, Functions as a keeps texture stable and humectant
